title: Authors and Citation
text: Timothy Beechey. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Beechey T (2024). clubpro: Classification Using Binary Procrustes Rotation. R package version 0.6.0, https://timbeechey.github.io/clubpro/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {clubpro: Classification Using Binary Procrustes Rotation},   author = {Timothy Beechey},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.6.0},   url = {https://timbeechey.github.io/clubpro/}, }

title: Classification Using Binary Procrustes Rotation
text: R package classification using binary procrustes rotation based Grice (2011).

title: Classification Using Binary Procrustes Rotation
text: clubpro can installed CRAN: Install development version clubpro GitHub :

title: Classification Using Binary Procrustes Rotation
text: clubpro implementation subset methods described Grice (2011).

title: Classification Using Binary Procrustes Rotation
text: example ’ll use Friendly dataset carData package. data set consists counts correctly recalled words (40) across three experimental conditions. Run model quantify well count correct recalled words classified terms condition. Print summary model output. Plot classification results.
code: library(clubpro) library(carData) data(Friendly, package = "carData") dat <- Friendly str(dat) #> 'data.frame':    30 obs. of  2 variables: #>  $ condition: Factor w/ 3 levels "Before","Meshed",..: 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 ... #>  $ correct  : int  39 25 37 25 29 39 21 39 24 25 ... mod <- club(correct ~ condition, data = dat, nreps = 1000) summary(mod) #> ********** Model Summary **********n #> ----- Classification Results ----- #> Observations:  30  #> Missing observations:  0  #> Target groups:  3  #> Correctly classified observations:  15  #> Incorrectly classified observations:  7  #> Ambiguously classified observations:  8  #> PCC:  50  #> Median classification strength index:  0.74  #> ----- Randomisation Test Results ----- #> Random reorderings:  1000  #> Minimum random PCC:  20  #> Maximum random PCC:  83.33  #> Chance-value:  0.92 plot(mod)

title: Classification Using Binary Procrustes Rotation
text: Grice, J. W. (2011). Observation oriented modeling: Analysis cause behavioral sciences. Academic Press.

what: Classification accuracy for each observation. — accuracy
title: Classification accuracy for each observation. — accuracy
text: Classification accuracy observation.

title: Classification accuracy for each observation. — accuracy
Classification accuracy for each observation. — accuracy
text: m object class "clubprofit" produced club()

title: Classification accuracy for each observation. — accuracy
text: table

title: Classification accuracy for each observation. — accuracy
text: Returns character vector containing string corresponding observation indicating whether classification observation "correct", "incorrect", "ambigous".

title: Classification accuracy for each observation. — accuracy
code: mod <- club(rate ~ dose, data = caffeine) accuracy(mod) #>       #>       correct incorrect ambiguous #>   0         5         5         0 #>   100       6         4         0 #>   200       7         3         0

title: Caffeine data — caffeine
text: Effect three different doses caffeine finger tapping rate.

title: Caffeine data — caffeine
text: ## `caffeine` data frame 30 rows 2 columns: dose dose caffeine mg rate finger taps per minute

title: Caffeine data — caffeine
text: Hand D.J., Daly F., Lunn .D., McConway K.J., Ostrowski E. (1994) Handbook Small Data Sets. London: Chapman & Hall. Data set 50.

title: Classify observations. — club
text: club() used classify obervations using binary procrustes rotation.

title: Classify observations. — club
code: club(   f,   data,   imprecision = 0,   nreps = 1000L,   normalise_cols = TRUE,   reorder_obs = "shuffle" )

title: Classify observations. — club
text: f formula. data data.frame. imprecision number indicting margin imprecision allowed classification. nreps number replicates use randomisation test. normalise_cols boolean indicating whether normalise matrix columns. reorder_obs string indicating method reordering observations calculate c-values.

title: Classify observations. — club
text: object class "clubprofit" list containing folllowing components: prediction character vector predicted classifications. accuracy character vector indicating whether classification   "correct", "incorrect", "ambiguous". pcc percentage correct classifications. cval chance randomly reordered data producing PCC >=   observed PCC. pcc_replicates vector PCCs generated randomly reordered   data used calculate cval. call matched call.

title: Classification strength indices. — csi
text: Classification strength indices.

title: Classification strength indices. — csi
text: m object class "clubprofit" produced club()

title: Classification strength indices. — csi
text: numeric vector.

title: Classification strength indices. — csi
text: Returns vector containing classification strength index observation.

title: Chance value. — cval
text: Chance value.

title: Chance value. — cval
text: m object class "clubprofit" produced club()

title: Chance value. — cval
text: numeric value.

title: Chance value. — cval
text: Compute chance randomly reordered data results percentage correctly classified observations least high observed data.

title: Chance value. — cval
code: mod <- club(rate ~ dose, data = caffeine) cval(mod) #> [1] 0.499

title: Individual level classification results. — individual_results
text: Individual level classification results.

title: Individual level classification results. — individual_results
text: m object class "clubprofit" produced club() digits integer

title: Individual level classification results. — individual_results
text: Returns data.frame containing predicted classifications classification accuracy individual observation.

title: Print a summary of results from a fitted clubpro model. — summary.clubprofit
text: object object class "clubprofit". ... ignored digits integer used rounding numeric values output.

text: return value, called side effects.

title: Print a summary of results from a fitted clubpro model. — summary.clubprofit
code: mod <- club(rate ~ dose, data = caffeine) summary(mod) #> ********** Model Summary **********n #> ----- Classification Results ----- #> Observations:  30  #> Missing observations:  0  #> Target groups:  3  #> Correctly classified observations:  18  #> Incorrectly classified observations:  12  #> Ambiguously classified observations:  0  #> PCC:  60  #> Median classification strength index:  0.8  #> ----- Randomisation Test Results ----- #> Random reorderings:  1000  #> Minimum random PCC:  23.33  #> Maximum random PCC:  80  #> Chance-value:  0.49

title: clubpro (development version)
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package.

title: clubpro 0.6.0
text: Models now specified using formula syntax.

title: clubpro 0.6.0
text: Added getter methods accessing individual elements model output. Added data sets. Show observed PCC reference line pcc_replicates plot.
